intro: Tepualia stipularis var. philippiana, commonly known as the Philippine stipularia, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, herbaceous stems and alternate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
